Grimwire has no backend dependencies. It is fully client-side, and can be hosted statically by Apache, Nginx, and any other Web server. Services can theme and deploy it for their users, and individuals can host their own instance – or use the nightly build on GitHub pages.

Everything is built for P2P multi-user computing. Once WebRTC and the necessary permissions tools are ready, Grimwire will transport requests between browsers, allowing users to serve applications directly to each other without operating a dedicated host.
